prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0185, 0.0185, 0.0046] 1. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 2. Within the sketch, create a new loop (loop_1) consisting of the following curves: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.713, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.713, 0.0], End Point [0.713, 0.4551] - line_3: Start Point [0.713, 0.4551], End Point [0.5755, 0.5926] - line_4: Start Point [0.5755, 0.5926], End Point [0.0, 0.5926] - line_5: Start Point [0.0, 0.5926], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The loop is closed, and as a result, the last point of line_5 should be coincident with the first point of line_1. 1. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale parameter: 0.713 2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 3. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0046 - operation: Create a new solid body **Part 2: Three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat base and a tapered top, resembling a pyramid** Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat base and a tapered top, resembling a pyramid. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0046] 1. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 2. Within the sketch, create a new loop (loop_1) consisting of the following curves: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.4813] - line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.4813], End Point [0.6017, 0.6296] - line_4: Start Point [0.6017, 0.6296], End Point [0.0, 0.6296] - line_5: Start Point [0.0, 0.6296], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The loop is closed, and as a result, the last point of line_5 should be coincident with the first point of line_1. 1. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale parameter: 0.75 2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 3. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.5 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - operation: Joinexisting body with new body</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0185,0.0185,0.0046]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.713,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.713,0.0],"End Point":[0.713,0.4551]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.713,0.4551],"End Point":[0.5755,0.5926]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5755,0.5926],"End Point":[0.0,0.5926]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5926],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0046,"sketch_scale":0.713,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0046]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.4813]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.4813],"End Point":[0.6017,0.6296]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.6017,0.6296],"End Point":[0.0,0.6296]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.6296],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 Next, create the 2D sketch for part 1 on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of two faces. For face 1, create a loop with the following curves: - line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.1875, 0.0) - line 2: Start Point (0.1875, 0.0), End Point (0.0, 0.1875) - line 3: Start Point (0.0, 0.1875), End Point (0.0, 0.0) For face 2, create a loop with the following curves: - line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.1875), End Point (0.1875, 0.0) - line 2: Start Point (0.1875, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.5625, 0.1875) - line 4: Start Point (0.5625, 0.1875), End Point (0.0, 0.1875) Note that each loop is closed and the total number of curves for part 1 is 7. Now, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Then, extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model of part 1 with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1875 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 The final shape of part 1 is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. The length of part 1 is approximately 0.1875 units, the width is approximately 0.75 units, and the height is also approximately 0.75 units. Perform the described operations without any additional assumptions. The final shape of the entire assembly is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.1875,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.1875,0.0],"End Point":[0.0,0.1875]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.1875],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.1875],"End Point":[0.1875,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.1875,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.5625,0.1875]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5625,0.1875],"End Point":[0.0,0.1875]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1875,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 45.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on Face 1** of the coordinate system with the following components: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0]; End Point [0.5, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.5, 0.0]; End Point [0.5, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.5, 0.75]; End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75]; End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** to 75% of its original size. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch** into a 3D sketch with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.3 units - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 units - Sketch scale: 0.75 Part 2: Prism with Curved Side Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.3] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on Face 1** of the coordinate system with the following components: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0]; End Point [0.15, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.15, 0.0]; End Point [0.15, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.15, 0.75]; End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75]; End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** to 75% of its original size. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch** into a 3D sketch with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 units - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.15 units - Sketch scale: 0.75 Part 3: Cylindrical Object with Ridges Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. It has a series of ridges along its length. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.225, 0.275, 0.3] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on Face 1** of the coordinate system with the following component: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: Center [0.1, 0.1]; Radius 0.1 3. **Transform the 2D sketch** into a 3D sketch with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 units - Extrude depth opposite normal: 1.25 units - Sketch scale: 0.2 The final shape after combining all the parts will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions are as follows: - Length: 2.0 units - Width: 1.0 units - Height: 1.65 units</description>
completion:

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.3,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.3]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.15,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.15,0.0],"End Point":[0.15,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.15,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.15,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}},"part_3":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.225,0.275,0.3]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1,0.1],"Radius":0.1}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":1.25,"sketch_scale":0.2,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face. The object has two holes on the front face, one on each side. The holes are cylindrical in shape and are aligned vertically. The object is centered in the image. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles as follows: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector as follows: [0.0, 0.0625, 0.0]. Sketch Create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch has the following components. Face 1 Face 1 of the sketch consists of 4 lines and has 4 loops. * Loop 1: Create a loop using the following lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.625]. 3. Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.625]. 4. Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.0]. * Loop 2: Create a circle centered at [0.0312, 0.3125] with a radius of 0.0125. * Loop 3: Create a circle centered at [0.375, 0.3125] with a radius of 0.0312. * Loop 4: Create a circle centered at [0.375, 0.0313] with a radius of 0.0125. Extrusion Extrude the sketch using the following parameters. * Extrude Depth Towards Normal (from the X-Y plane): 0.0625. * Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0. * Sketch Scale: 0.75. * Operation: Create a new solid body. Completed Part 1 The completed part should match the provided description. The height, width, and length of part 1 are 0.75, 0.0625, and 0.75 respectively (not including the holes). For the holes on the front face, a separate part should be created with the appropriate shape and dimensions.</description>
